544981 THE PARLIAMENTARY PROCEEDINGS (PROTECTION OFPUBLICATION) ACT, 1977
ACT NO. 15 OF 1977 [ 18th. April, 1977.]
An Act to protect the publication of reports of proceedings of Parliament.
BE it enacted by Parliament in the Twenty- eighth Year of the Republic of India as follows:-
1
Short title, extent and commencement.
1616741 1 Short title, extent and commencement.
370809 1This Act may be called the Parliamentary Proceedings (Protection of Publication) Act, 1977.
1744220 2It extends to the whole of India except the State of Jammu and Kashmir.
488091 3It shall be deemed to have come into force on the 25th day of March, 1977.
2
Definition.
504330 2Definition. In this Act," newspaper" means any printed periodical work containing public news or comments on public news, and includes a news agency supplying material for publication in a newspaper.
3
Publication of reports of Parliamentary proceedings privileged.
983147 3 Publication of reports of Parliamentary proceedings privileged.
1357656 1Save as otherwise provided in sub- section (2), no person shall be liable to any proceedings, civil or criminal, in any court in respect of the publication in a newspaper of a substantially true report of any proceedings of either House of Parliament, unless the publication is proved to have been made with malice.
1912251 2Nothing in sub- section (1) shall be construed as protecting the publication of any matter, the publication of which is not for the public good.
4
Act also to apply to Parliamentary proceedings broadcast by wirelesstelegraphy.
779576 4Act also to apply to Parliamentary proceedings broadcast by wireless telegraphy. This Act shall apply in relation to reports or matters broadcast by means of wireless telegraphy as part of any programme or service provided by means of a broadcasting station situate within the territories to which this Act extends as it applies in relation to reports or matters published in a newspaper.
